message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LO, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC 

The paper deals with formalizing security proofs for Multi-Party Computation (MPC) protocols, which is a topic closely related to cryptography and security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the use of simulation-based approaches, which is a topic in logic and verification (cs.LO). The implementation of the proofs is done using the CryptHOL framework, which is a tool for information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the use of probabilistic programs, which is a topic in data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper deals with the formal verification of cryptography arguments, which is a topic in computational complexity (cs.CC).
